title: Are we at the lowest point in US history in 2020? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Really? Have some perspective. It’s not even close. By a long way. COVID is gnarly for sure, most of the rest is just political fluff and nonsense compared to what came before and made for really, really bad years. The following is by no means comprehensive. All the years of The Civil War and many in the run up, as the row over the abhorrence of Slavery got more heated. Hundreds of thousands were killed. The Spanish Flu pandemic from 1918, which makes Coronavirus look what it is, pretty minor. It seriously brought death to the most vulnerable late 20s-30s age group, who were most likely to be economically active and young parents, creating a generation of orphans. Decades of sadness followed. The various and numerous Plague Years of typhus and cholera outbreaks in the 19th Century, before they knew what caused them let alone cured them, making then virulent, deadly and genuinely terrifying. The years up until inbound Slave Importing was banned. Shameful. The tolerance of extant Slaves for the decades afterwards, the tolerance of inhuman treatment and that no escapee was safe even in the non-Slave states. Shameful years, which many US citizens felt acutely at the time and went on to give their lives fighting to defeat it in the CW. Shameful decades. Most years up to around say 1880 when Infant mortality ran at truly staggeringly high levels with untold grief, lost to History by its sheer normalcy, especially in plague years, but was routinely pandemic in scale with only a gradual but steady decline until say 1960 or so when Polio was finally got under control. Most years of The Great Depression. Most years of The Vietnam War. Many years of the later 19th Century and the shameful decline in the treatment of Native Americans from the decades of prior shameful treatment before that. Massacres, ethnic cleansing, forced relocation and repeated Treaty violations by the US Government. Shameful every one. The years the US was fighting in WW1 and WW2 when tens of thousands of young US men were killed each year. You could probably argue it’s not even bottom half, certainly not bottom third, despite The Mad Big Bad Orange Man.

The USA is in a phase known as revolution and it has occurred in multiple presidencies: Jefferson in 1801Jackson, 1829Lincoln, 1861Roosevelt, 1933Each of these revolutions was a game-changer that discarded the status quo and toppled establishment norms. One could argue these revolutions were driven by the economy and disenfranchisement, much like today’s revolution that is playing out on main street USA and around the world.

It sure looks that way. It’s like a pre civil war tension exists in society. Remember, the bloodiest war the United States ever fought was our very own Civil War. These leftists need to allow that to marinate, before they make their final move that will seal their fates. I mean, just how much more of this overblown shit do they think the country is going to put up with? It’s going to get fuckin’ ugly!

We are at our highest point. For the first time in our history there is a global effort to address systemic racism and police brutality. It will take decades, if not centuries, but our society is about to experience a fundamental shift in racial relationships.
Oh, no … Trump has not resigned yet. He has still a few surprises up his sleeves. Wait until the rallies are going ahead again. The "fake facts” he will deliver then.
No where near. In 1951 I was shown how to kneel on the floor of the school hallway, put my face against the wall, my hands over my head and wait for the H-bomb to go BOOM.
